channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Behind cars in car park, 15th December
item.description:
More dumping of rubbish in Dandridge close car park. Dumped wood, broken down furniture and metal beds.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dandridge Close, Greenwich

item.title: Food waste all over the street, 15th December
item.description:
Food waste is left all over the street, gets trodden on and begins to rot. The street needs deep cleaned as it's bringing pigeons, squirrels, rats, foxes to eat the waste and tear up bin bags. The vendors bring rotten food in the truck and it sits there all day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68-70, Rye Lane, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Flytipped Mattress, 15th December
item.description:
Someone has left a double mattress over the gate of Climsland house on Dutchy Street. Please come and collect it as soon as possible as it is clearly blocking the entrance for the 20 resident flats of this block.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duchy Street, Waterloo, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfen Road, Blendon, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish at top of close at 56 Crampton St, 15th December
item.description:
Right at the top of the close at 56 Crampton St (I.e. at the stairs with the entry to the roof) there is cardboard, an old mattress and various rubbish. Please can this be tidied up asap as it is blocking access to the roof.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Crampton Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Antisocial behaviour caused by youths on skateboards., 15th December
item.description:
The bench opposite Bermondsey Arts Club, 102A Tower Bridge Road SE1 4TP is being used by skateboarders regularly. I called the Police on Sunday and when they arrived at tht scene they confirmed that this constitutes antisocial behaviour which results in damage to the bench. Having spoken to many local residents, we would all be grateful if this bench was removed or relocated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light, 15th December
item.description:
Street light outside 14 Penshurst Green is not working. My mother has called a number of times and no one has come to review. She is 80 and nervous - please can someone review.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penshurst Green, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
